title: Bug 50059 - Resources not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml
description: Bug 50059 - Resources are not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml. Make a Servlet 3.0 webapp (let's name it 'foo') with metadatacomplete="true" attribute set on the webapp element in the /WEBINF/web.xml.
OB: When a Servlet 3.0 webapp with metadatacomplete="true" is created, resources located in /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources are not being served as expected.
EB: The jar file, named 'bar.jar', should be placed in the /WEBINF/lib directory, and its resources located in /METAINF/resources should be served correctly, even when the 'metadatacomplete' attribute is set to 'true' in the web.xml.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a Servlet 3.0 webapp named 'foo'. 
2. Set the 'metadatacomplete' attribute to 'true' in the /WEBINF/web.xml file. 
3. Place the 'bar.jar' file in the /WEBINF/lib directory. 
4. Verify that resources within 'bar.jar/METAINF/resources' are not served as expected when accessing the web application.
